dependencies.x-intellij-html-description: The list of modules and libraries necessary to build the Module. [Read more](#dependencies)
dependencies.title: The list of modules and libraries necessary to build the Module

repositories.x-intellij-html-description: The list of repositories used to look up and download the Module dependencies. [Read more](#managing-maven-repositories)
repositories.title: The list of repositories used to look up and download the Module dependencies

settings.x-intellij-html-description: Configures the toolchains used in the build process. [Read more](#settings)
settings.title: Configures the toolchains used in the build process

tasks.x-intellij-html-description: Tasks settings. Experimental and will be replaced
tasks.title: Tasks settings. Experimental and will be replaced

test-dependencies.x-intellij-html-description: The dependencies necessary to build and run tests of the Module. [Read more](#dependencies)
test-dependencies.title: The dependencies necessary to build and run tests of the Module

test-settings.x-intellij-html-description: Configures the toolchains used in the build process of the module's tests. [Read more](#settings)
test-settings.title: Configures the toolchains used in the build process of the module's tests

id.x-intellij-html-description: The ID of the repository, used for to reference it. Defaults to the repository url
id.title: The ID of the repository, used for to reference it. Defaults to the repository url

publish.x-intellij-html-description: Whether this repository can be used to publish artifacts
publish.title: Whether this repository can be used to publish artifacts

resolve.x-intellij-html-description: Whether this repository can be used to resolve artifacts
resolve.title: Whether this repository can be used to resolve artifacts

file.x-intellij-html-description: A relative path to a file with the credentials. Currently, only `*.property` files are supported
file.title: A relative path to a file with the credentials. Currently, only `*.property` files are supported

passwordKey.x-intellij-html-description: A key in the file that holds the password
passwordKey.title: A key in the file that holds the password

usernameKey.x-intellij-html-description: A key in the file that holds the username
usernameKey.title: A key in the file that holds the username

junit.x-intellij-html-description: JUnit test runner on the JVM and Android platforms. Read more about [testing support](#tests)
junit.title: JUnit test runner on the JVM and Android platforms

kotlin.x-intellij-html-description: Kotlin language and the compiler settings
kotlin.title: Kotlin language and the compiler settings

kover.x-intellij-html-description: Kover settings for code coverage. Read more [about Kover](https://kotlin.github.io/kotlinx-kover/gradle-plugin/)
kover.title: Kover settings for code coverage. Read more about Kover

applicationId.x-intellij-html-description: The ID for the application on a device and in the Google Play Store. [Read more](https://developer.android.com/build/configure-app-module#set-namespace)
applicationId.title: The ID for the application on a device and in the Google Play Store

compileSdk.x-intellij-html-description: The API level to compile the code. The code can use only the Android APIs up to that API level. [Read more](https://developer.android.com/reference/tools/gradle-api/com/android/build/api/dsl/CommonExtension#compileSdk())
compileSdk.title: The API level to compile the code. The code can use only the Android APIs up to that API level. )

maxSdk.x-intellij-html-description: Maximum API level on which the application can run. [Read more](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/uses-sdk-element.html)
maxSdk.title: Maximum API level on which the application can run

minSdk.x-intellij-html-description: Minimum API level needed to run the application. [Read more](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/uses-sdk-element.html)
minSdk.title: Minimum API level needed to run the application

namespace.x-intellij-html-description: A Kotlin or Java package name for the generated `R` and `BuildConfig` classes. [Read more](https://developer.android.com/build/configure-app-module#set-namespace)
namespace.title: A Kotlin or Java package name for the generated `R` and `BuildConfig` classes

targetSdk.x-intellij-html-description: The target API level for the application. [Read more](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/uses-sdk-element.html)
targetSdk.title: The target API level for the application

propertiesFile.x-intellij-html-description: Properties file where the keystore data is stored.
propertiesFile.title: Properties file where the keystore data is stored

enabled.x-intellij-html-description: Enable Compose runtime, dependencies and the compiler plugins
enabled.title: Enable Compose runtime, dependencies and the compiler plugins

framework.x-intellij-html-description: (Only for the library [product type](#product-types) Configure the generated framework to [share the common code with an Xcode project](https://kotlinlang.org/docs/multiplatform-mobile-understand-project-structure.html#ios-framework)
framework.title: Configure the generated framework to share the common code with an Xcode project

teamId.x-intellij-html-description:
A Team ID is a unique string assigned to your team by Apple.
It's necessary if you want to run/test on a Apple device.
Read [how to locate your team ID in Xcode](https://developer.apple.com/help/account/manage-your-team/locate-your-team-id/), or use [KDoctor tool](https://github.com/Kotlin/kdoctor) (`kdoctor --team-ids`)
teamId.title:
A Team ID is a unique string assigned to your team by Apple.
It's necessary if you want to run/test on a Apple device.
Read how to locate your team ID in Xcode, or use KDoctor tool

basename.x-intellij-html-description: The name of the generated framework
basename.title: The name of the generated framework

isStatic.x-intellij-html-description: Whether to create a dynamically linked or statically linked framework
isStatic.title: Whether to create a dynamically linked or statically linked framework

mainClass.x-intellij-html-description: (Only for `jvm/app` [product type](#product-types)). The fully-qualified name of the class used to run the application
mainClass.title: The fully-qualified name of the class used to run the application

release.x-intellij-html-description: The minimum JVM release version that the code should be compatible with. This enforces compatibility on 3 levels. First, it is used as the target version for the bytecode generated from Kotlin and Java sources. Second, it limits the Java platform APIs available to Kotlin and Java sources. Third, it limits the Java language constructs in Java sources. If this is set to null, these constraints are not applied and the compiler defaults are used.
release.title: The minimum JVM release version that the code should be compatible with. This enforces compatibility on 3 levels. First, it is used as the target version for the bytecode generated from Kotlin and Java sources. Second, it limits the Java platform APIs available to Kotlin and Java sources. Third, it limits the Java language constructs in Java sources. If this is set to null, these constraints are not applied and the compiler defaults are used

allWarningsAsErrors.x-intellij-html-description: Turn any warnings into a compilation error
allWarningsAsErrors.title: Turn any warnings into a compilation error

apiVersion.x-intellij-html-description: Allow using declarations only from the specified version of Kotlin bundled libraries
apiVersion.title: Allow using declarations only from the specified version of Kotlin bundled libraries

languageVersion.x-intellij-html-description: Source compatibility with the specified version of Kotlin
languageVersion.title: Source compatibility with the specified version of Kotlin

optIns.x-intellij-html-description: Usages of API that [requires opt-in](https://kotlinlang.org/docs/opt-in-requirements.html) with a requirement annotation with the given fully qualified name
optIns.title: Usages of API that requires opt-in with a requirement annotation with the given fully qualified name

progressiveMode.title: Enable the progressive mode for the compiler

suppressWarnings.x-intellij-html-description: Suppress the compiler from displaying warnings during compilation
suppressWarnings.title: Suppress the compiler from displaying warnings during compilation

verbose.x-intellij-html-description: Enable verbose logging output which includes details of the compilation process
verbose.title: Enable verbose logging output which includes details of the compilation process

processorOptions.x-intellij-html-description: Some options to pass to KSP processors. Refer to each processor documentation for details.
processorOptions.title: Some options to pass to KSP processors. Refer to each processor documentation for details

processors.x-intellij-html-description: The list of KSP processors to use (maven coordinates or catalog references)
processors.title: The list of KSP processors to use

version.x-intellij-html-description: The version of KSP to use
version.title: The version of KSP to use

entryPoint.x-intellij-html-description: The fully-qualified name of the application's entry point function
entryPoint.title: The fully-qualified name of the application's entry point function

group.x-intellij-html-description: Group ID of the published Maven artifact
group.title: Group ID of the published Maven artifact

name.x-intellij-html-description: Artifact ID of the published Maven artifact
name.title: Artifact ID of the published Maven artifact

version.x-intellij-html-description: Version of the published Maven artifact
version.title: Version of the published Maven artifact
